refnamediv.refpurpose: lpeconstelm is a filter which removes constant parameters in a linear process equation.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If it can be determined that a parameter an LPE remains constant throughout any run of the process, all occurrences of that process parameter are replaced by the initial value and process parameter is removed from the list of process parameters.

If the initial value of a process parameter is a free variable and remains a free variable throughout the run of the process, the process variable is constant and the process parameter is replaced by the last assigned, free variable.

If the initial value of a process parameter is a free variable and is only changed ones to a certain value, the process parameter is constant, and the certain value is used for substitution. If the process parameter changes to various values, the process parameter is marked variable.

refsect1.title: File

listitem.para: &lpeconstelm; reads from &stdin;, and writes an LPE to &stdout;.
&lpeconstelm; reads from file &infile;, and writes an LPE to &stdout;.
&lpeconstelm; reads from file &infile;, and writes an LPE to file &outfile;.
&lpeconstelm; reads from file &stdin;, and writes an LPE to file &outfile;.

refsect1.para: Note that &lpeconstelm; reads and writes in LPE-format.

listitem.para: Displays short intermediate information during the run of the program. If a &outfile; is given, &lpeconstelm; writes the LPE to that given file. If no &outfile; is given it will only display process information.

Displays detailed intermediate information during the run of the program. If a &outfile; is given, &lpeconstelm; writes the LPE to that given file. If no &outfile; is given it will only display process information.

&lpeconstelm; will not determine if a condition of a summand is false or not. All conditions are be treated true if this option is used. This option may take less time, however it may find less constant constant process parameters.
&lpeconstelm; will not remove the summands which are not visited. By default, summands which are not visited are removed from the LPE.
&lpeconstelm; will not remove process parameters which have values from which the sort only contain one element.
